<title level="1" pfs="">[Demon, Urglid](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2153)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

The hulking monstrosities known as urglids form from the souls of murderous undertakers, sadists who buried their victims alive, and intentionally neglectful grave keepers who gave up their watch over the dead. Standing over 30 feet tall and weighing over 3,000 pounds, the demon's head seems sunken into its torso, and a gaping, toothy mouth opens at the top of its chest.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 33

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 28
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Demon_Urglid.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 13">[Urglid (Grave Demon)](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2153)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="CE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Demon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=42" />
<trait label="Fiend" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=70" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #184: The Ghouls Hunger](/Sources.aspx?ID=147) pg. 83</row>

**Perception** +20; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=40) (imprecise) 60 feet, [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344)

**Languages**
[Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) 100 feet

**Skills**
[Abyss Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +24, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +27, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +24, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +22, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +27, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +24, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +22, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +27

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +9

**Dex** +4

**Con** +8

**Int** +4

**Wis** +3

**Cha** +4
</row>

**Consecration Vulnerability** Dedicated to the desecration of graves, an urglid takes 3d6+6 mental damage each round it's within the area of an effect with the [consecration](/Traits.aspx?ID=34) trait. In addition, the demon takes triple the damage from [_holy water_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=245).

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 31 

**Fort** +26 

**Ref** +20 

**Will** +20 

+1 status to all saves vs. [magic](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)
</row>

**HP** 290

**Weaknesses**
[cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 10, good 10

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 30 feet, burrow 40 feet, climb 20 feet; earth glide

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +27 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [deadly 2d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 3d10+16 slashing damage

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
leg +25 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 3d12+21 bludgeoning

**Divine Innate Spells** DC 30
- **3rd**
[Earthbind](/Spells.aspx?ID=94) (at will)
- **5th**
[Passwall](/Spells.aspx?ID=216) (at will), [Wall of Stone](/Spells.aspx?ID=365) (×3)
- **8th**
[Earthquake](/Spells.aspx?ID=95)
- **Constant (6th)**
[True Seeing](/Spells.aspx?ID=344)

**Divine Rituals** DC 32

- **1st**
[Abyssal Pact](/Rituals.aspx?ID=21)

**Earth Glide**   The urglid can [Burrow](/Actions.aspx?ID=93) through any earthen matter, including rock. When they do so, the urglid moves at their full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing unless they choose to do so.

**Gravechoke** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Conjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=33), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55), [Olfactory](/Traits.aspx?ID=246)) The urglid emits a putrid pulse that targets all living creatures within a 30-foot emanation. Creatures in this area that fail a DC 30 Fortitude save become [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) (sickened 2 on a critical failure).

**Ravenous Earth** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Conjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=33), [Earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55), [Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64)) With a single, devious thought, the urglid causes a mound of grave soil to well up at a creature's feet. A creature failing a DC 30 Reflex save is [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33). The restrained creature then begins sinking below the ground into a spontaneously formed grave. A creature restrained by this ability for three rounds is buried 6 feet deep in the ground and begins [suffocating](/Rules.aspx?ID=468) within 1 minute. A buried creature must be dug up to be freed (see [Burial](/Rules.aspx?ID=647)). A creature who is slain by Ravenous Earth rises as a [ghoul](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=52) the next midnight.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Kabriri's Excavators</title>

While many loathe urglids for their ravenous appetite for burial and wanton destruction, priests of [Kabriri](/Deities.aspx?ID=76) insist that the demon lord blessed and oversaw their creation, trusting the fiends with digging the labyrinthine network of tunnels that connect Everglut with the [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1). It's no surprise, then, that where there's an urglid, there's possibly a pathway to the [Abyss](/Planes.aspx?ID=13)— and plenty of [ghouls](/Monsters.aspx?ID=218).
</aside>
